sec.title: John J. Mahlmann Conference Room Dedicated at NAfME Headquarters
sec.p: On December 6, 2012, the National Association of Music Education hosted a group of education dignitaries rarely seen together. MENC Past Presidents Paul R. Lehman and Barbara L. Geer; current NAfME President Nancy E. Ditmer; Sam Hope, executive director of the National Association of Schools of Music; James Gates, former executive director of the National Council of Teachers of Mathematics; and Kendall Starkweather, executive director of the International Technology and Engineering Educators Association (who retired at the end of December), gathered with headquarters staff at 1806 Robert Fulton Drive in Reston, Virginia, for a luncheon and dedication ceremony.

Following opening words by NAfME Executive Director Michael A. Butera, his predecessor, MENC Executive Director John J. Mahlmann, was honored (and roasted a bit!) by Paul Lehman and Barbara Geer, whose presidencies were the first and last during Mahlmann’s twenty-seven years of service to music education. Nancy Ditmer also shared memories of her encounters with Mahlmann.

After a ribbon-cutting ceremony, a new executive conference room on the second floor of the headquarters building was officially dedicated in Mahlmann’s name. The space contains a large table that will accommodate a dozen people and has several high-tech amenities, including a large flat-panel television/computer screen that will allow presentations of several kinds. The room looks out over woodland to Sunrise Valley Drive beyond.
Mahlmann and his wife Ning-Ning were delighted with the event. Near the end of the ceremony, Mahlmann quipped, “Now when I visit NAfME, I’ll always have someplace to go!”
Nancy E. Ditmer, John J. Mahlmann (holding plaque), and Michael A. Butera in the newly dedicated John J. Mahlmann Conference Room. (Photo by Trinh Hoang.)

In the new John J. Mahlmann Conference Room, front row, left to right: Nancy E. Ditmer, John J. Mahlmann, and Barbara L. Geer; back row, left to right: Michael A. Butera, Kendall Starkweather, Sam Hope, Paul R. Lehman, and James Gates. (Photo by Trinh Hoang.)
